alert.note: Alert for Delta; Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN DELTA AND CENTRAL MENOMINEE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT/415 PM CDT/... At 454 PM EDT/354 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hermansville to near Stephenson to 10 miles southeast of Wausaukee. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Escanaba, Stephenson, Powers, Cedar River, Hermansville, Bagley, Ford River, Wilson, Spalding, Bark River, Nadeau, Gourley, Daggett, Carney, Ingalls, Wells State Park, Birch Creek, Arthur Bay, Hyde, and Wallace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
